intro: Asaemia minuta, commonly known as the small asaemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Asaemia minuta is a rare and lesser-known member of the carrot family, with limited distribution in specific regions.
